text: Food: 1 Service: 3 Cleanliness: 1 My 3rd time here just because of its proximity to the office and only 1 time has it been good and edible - to go. Service isn't super friendly as well.. either stern or emotionless.  The 1st visit I got the chicken salad sandwich and open up to see a fruit fly having a grand time in the lettuce. The 2nd visit was bc a friend stopped by and wanted something simple. He got the soup of the day and one of their bread pastries, ok! The most recent visit... I got the basics of all, grilled cheese and chicken noodle soup.  Grilled cheese was nothing special. 2 piece bread and layer of melted cheddar cheese, okay. Can't go wrong with that. A couple bites into my chicken noodle soup I find an egg shell. An. Egg. Shell. Why the heck would there be an egg shell?! Clearly it's either by the disposable or they're just careless when making their sandwiches and soups. Ugh.  Would I return? I tried. Never again.

Gross is me being nice to describe my meal. I was looking for a quick bite to go and asked the cashier if he would suggest the Mediterranean  chicken or the turkey burger. He said def the burger. Done deal!  While I waited the cashier was on his phone the entire time. I was sitting on the side watching fruit flies inside their pastry cabinet just hanging out with their bakery items... Fire the burger is inside a pita, which actually makes it easier to eat in my opinion. Well it had a strange smell... I took a small bite to play t safe and out it went!! I got a feeling these were frozen burgers from Walmart! It was disgusting! It's far from fresh! Makes me question all their food.  At this point I'm starving! I attempt the fries which are actually great! Perfectly crispy! I dip into the ranch I paid 59 cents for to realize it's expired ranch. Disgusting.  I will never ever return again. Not even for the fries. Just not worth it.

Just walked in for a coffee to go... There was no line at the order area, the guy working walked away, came back but didn't even look at me. He went on to keep his back turned from me as he continued with the drink he was making...  I walked out and I won't be back, which sucks because I was actually happy to come upon a place i hadn't noticed before in my neighborhood.
Love this gem! Great diner nestled in design driven area of Chicago.  Very good, clean, healthy food options. Vegetarian friendly.  Very tasty!  Friendly employees!
Poor service.  Staff was unable to describe the pastry flavors nor were they willing to find out.  Cappuccino mediocre.  Chocolate chip cookie was not fresh.

Great neighborhood lunch spot. They always have one or two specials a day that are consistently good. This place is a step up in quality compared to other counter-order locations in the city.  The staff is as friendly as you need them to be. Highly recommend: Turkey club Bacon Cheeseburger Corned beef sandwich Pro tip: Order ahead for pick up to avoid heavy lines during lunch.

Service needs work.  Ordered a reuben at 12:30 today, didn't get it until 5 after 1. Order came up and sat by the register in front.  I stood at the counter, patiently waiting for my food.  No one ever checked in with me.  Eventually, after another reuben came up - someone that no doubt ordered well after i did - i spoke up, and instead of an apology or "how can we make this right" i got "why didn't you say something"?   Food is decent but in this neighborhood there are too many other great options to deal with lousy service and bad attitudes Won't be back.

We're visiting Chicago on a combo work/pleasure trip this weekend. Our hosts took us to Brett's for breakfast because it was close to the office.  First item of importance was coffee! Unfortunately, we were disappointed. The simple "cup of coffee" was good although I'm always disappointed when a sit-down cafe serves coffee in paper cups. The disappointment came when my spouse asked for a decaf... "we don't brew decaf on the weekend" was the response. How about a decaf espresso drink, then? "We don't have decaf espresso." Kind of a bummer... The selection of baked goods was nice. Several types of breads - both sweet and savory - and various pastries. The banana bread was moist and had a nice flavor.  I ordered the special -  Huevos rancheros. Interestingly I was given the option of tortillas or cornmeal waffles. I decided to try the waffles. I was initially surprised at the simplicity of the dish when it was served. Eggs on waffles with a tablespoon of black beans, Pico de Gallo,  and guacamole. While the dish had a nice flavor, it was somewhat dry. The waffles needed something to add some moisture to the dish... not sure what, I'm not a chef!, but something.  Would I go back? Yeah, probably. Give it a try - it was busy so I imagine that their food is probably pretty good overall.

Nice little deli close to school for me. You walk in and it's got an open top grill (one of my favorite kind of grills - it reminds me of going to diners with my dad when I was a kid). It's got a whole diner decor feel, too. I like that they offer sweet potato fries and regular fries. I don't go to deli's too often, but I usually see chips as a side and no fries. I love fries so I was super happy. They have a good sized menu of burgers, sandwiches, soups and sides. They do breakfast, too. It's a good place to go because they have a big enough menu to cater to what food you feel like eating. I got the tuna melt. It was a tall sandwich! There was a very good amount of tuna on it, but I wanted more cheese. It didn't exactly melt over the tuna since it was one slice over a mountain of tuna.  I'd go back to this place if I am feeling like getting a meal that will keep me full for a while.

This is right by my work and I am obsessed with their black bean burger and sweet potato fries. The burger doesn't fall apart and has a delicious spicy mayo and the fries are nice and crispy. Their other options are pretty decent as well but nothing comes as close to the burger. I go there at least once a week. The seating area is pretty small but I always get it to go. Be sure to call ahead and place your order if you are planning on going there around lunch time. It gets really busy during lunch.

This is a solid choice is you are craving a simple and fresh meal. It's the type of place where you can get a no frills soup, sandwich or burger. Kinda feels like something you could whip up yourself but the taste is consistently good. There's not too many places like this in the area so it can get busy, especially during the work week lunch rush. It sits right under the Chicago and Franklin L stop, so it's convenient for grabbing food before heading to work. You order from the counter and then move down the line and wait for your number to be called. Most people take their food to go, but there are table if you want to eat in.  Last time I was there I got the grilled chicken sandwich on wheat. It was simple but really yummy. It came with half a pickle which was a nice surprise too.  My only hang up with this place is the price. It always seems a little to expensive for the type of food and the portions served. I think knocking everything down $2 dollars would be fair. The vibe is a local, fast and easy neighborhood spot, but the price doesn't really match that.

This is my go-to breakfast spot before work in the morning. The coffee is amazing and all of their cake slices are to die for (especially the Ricotta Rum). Family owned and very friendly staff. I have yet to try the lunch options but I hear they're great!

The staff of this restaurant are not pleasant.  They serve excellent slices of cake for $3 (especially the apple orange). Brett's decreased the cake slice by half but not the price. At one point they had a woman taking orders who barely spoke English and was serving incorrect orders.  If you took it back you're given attitude rather than an apology.  I ordered a corn beef sandwich for about $10 it was not worth the money.  I work right next door and will walk elsewhere to avoid their bad customer service and overpriced food!
Don't waste your time they totally forgot my order then screwed it up.  First time here and my last.  Also no apology from any employee. $14 soup and sandwich and treated poorly.
The egg salad is incredible!!  Craveable with amazing tomato chutney on brown bread...yum!!'

A very nice lunch spot in the Gallery District - family owned, freshly made food and reasonably priced.   Had a turkey club and sweet potato fries.    I'll be back to check out the other options in the near future.

This place makes awesome sandwiches! Good menu selection too. Seating inside is limited so I usually do carry out. Only criticism is the gentleman who takes your order always seems annoyed and acts as if you interrupted hi
Only had a few minutes to grab something on our way out of Chicago. The staff is home-style and the egg salad sandwich, which I always use to judge a restaurant, was the bomb! Will eat here anytime

This review is not based on the food, I'm sure it's good. This review is solely based on the fact that  I paid $3 for "Mexican hot chocolate" that was literally a pack of powdered mix that they (right in front of me) took out of a box, ripped open, put in a cup and added milk to.   The least they could have done is hide the packaged powder to let me think that I wasn't charged  $3.00 for a mix they just pulled out of a box.

I have tried over and over again with this place! I have been working in the area for about two years now I went to the website to see the menu I then tried to place my order by calling and was inform that it was an "OLD" menu on the site and the prices and orders had changed so I adjusted. Finally 2016 a new menu has surfaced. So once again I tried ordering... the site menu states fries are included with burgers so I called to order and was informed that this too is an error. And that if I wanted fries that it was an extra $3, these kinds of errors are not good, none of my co workers go there due the misrepresentation of the menus. I personally feel that the food is really good and that they need to care more about how the website "ERRORS" can turn away even the hungriest customers

Best pancakes I ever had. Stopped in for a quick breakfast and ordered the "Gallery Special." 2 perfect pancakes, two eggs over medium, with sausage. Great breakfast for a great price. The coffee is excellent too!

Highly upset! Rude people is one of my pet peeves. If I'm not rude to you then don't be rude to me in any circumstances. From time to time I will get the same thing. A turkey sausage on a croissant with cheese.Here is the problem. I went to the cashier to pay for my food, I said " You guys change your prices all the time" (specifically the croissant sandwich), last time (literally last week Friday) I paid $5.00." The guy said "It has been the same price" I replied and said " No, it's a different cashier with a different price " The owner came and ask me " What was the problem?". I was charged  $5.00 last time. She cut me off and said "NO NO NO NO, that has always been the same price." What clearly blew me off was that she raised her voice as if I was lying. There is no reason for me to lie. Also, she could of kindly said "Sorry for the mistake, it's actually $5.75." I didn't like her approach at all. I get the same thing all the time,  they quote me a different price. She kept on ranting on how the price has always been the same. I'm not going to fight you nor am disrespecting you, so why are your raising your voice. I grab my sandwich and left, but the cook forgot to put my cheese on my croissant. I came back and the  lady said " What do you want now." I said " He forgot the cheese". He is right there, so ask him.He said that you didn't tell me you wanted cheese. I came here a few times, so I thought he would know. Anyway, I paid the 50 cents and went on my way. I felt her approach about the situation was unprofessional and it really rubbed me the wrong way.
Hidden gem!!! Best chicken salad sandwiches in Chicago. Super simple deli concept that's a ice change when you're sick of eating at trend concept restaurants.

This isn't your spot if you're vegetarian.  I ordered a grilled cheese with tomato and basil, simple enough.  I waited at the counter for my lunch as required so I had a great view of a sandwich that was straight cooked in bacon grease then lifted off the grill will a spatula covered in steak.  No joke, there were bits of steak stuck to the sandwich.  I told the gent working the grill that I won't be able to eat that as I am vegetarian.  So he says "Okay, I can give you this other one".  Silly me, I assumed "this other one" was another of the sandwich I ordered.  It was not, and it also tastes like bacon grease.  $12 for a sandwich I threw away and a tiny cup of coleslaw, I won't be back and I don't recommend this place.

If I order vegetarian sandwich, is it necessary to make it on bacon and burger grease..!? (Every time). Soup cups only filled half way.... They are cutting on portions and quality  and prices are going higher and higher. This place used to be much better.  I'm only giving 2 stars because of their banana and zucchini bread, that's pretty much the only thing I will continue buying there.

I can't understand the good reviews this place has. From my experiences (as well as  many of my co-workers) this place is not good. They serve stale bread, that is so stale it crumbles, amongst other things we've had that we're not good... food quality is just very poor, their prices are very high and as if the quality of their food wasn't already bad enough, they now replaced the chicken breast that they put on their cobb salad with some type of spongy substance we couldn't figure out what my friend was eating... they used to put real chicken breast on the salads but have switched to this gross spongy stuff that they're trying to pass off as chicken. Needless to say, with the poor quality of food and high prices, we will not go back there, well maybe JUST for coffee since the coffee is decent there. Oh and btw, if you're on your lunch hour or whatever and pressed for time, this is not the place to go as they are very slow!

Just paid $8 for 2 slices of bread and an egg in the middle. The cashier said "anything on it?" He looked annoyed and I said "What is there?" He looked mad and said "anything!" First time going there last time going in.
This place is great, and simple.   I got some egg whites and veggies in between two pieces of toast and it was great.  I highly recommend going there.

OK, gotta say this.. the food here is relatively okay but extremely overpriced for the paltry portion sizes.  The  real problem however is the horrible service.. every time I go in here.. I stand around waiting, although there are not many people ..  The clerks are so apathetic; they serve whoever talks to them first without considering who has been standing and patiently waiting for service.  I'll take my business elsewhere..

The food is good...I really like the sweet potato fries...the burgers are great and the chorizo and egg sandwich is good....it is a bit pricy and normally that would not bother me for good food.....BUT....the staff has such attitude. The cashier acts like he has been sentenced to hard labor....it is not pleasant to deal with him at all. I would have rated the place much better, but you are treated like you are bothering them when you come into the place....the cook is no better...just hands you the order like he can't wait for you to leave......

I think the food is pretty decent, I don't have any real complaints about the food itself. I will say I've now visited this place 3 to 4 times for lunch over the last year or so and each time, the customer service was wretched. I asked questions about menu items & the  person at the register hesitantly answers as if they are internally unwilling and annoyed that I would bother to ask, so yea, that's irritating, but the food is decent and it's a bit cramped in there during a rush so I usually order to go.  That is all, you may return to your regularly scheduled programming
Forgot how good this place is! Cute little neighborhood cafe...amazing sandwiches. Love the egg and potato salads. Delicious bagels and pastries....everything is very fresh.

I don't know what I would do without this lunch standby (turkey chili, to be exact.) Walking over to Brett's to check out the daily lunch special is often the highlight of my day. The people are friendly and the food comes out fast. Oftentimes I am a twice-daily visitor, as the breakfast burrito is fantastic. The price skews high for a diner, but you get what you pay for. I am really happy that this place is nearby.

This place is great to go to for a fast lunch and they have everything you could want. Breakfast, too. Prices aren't cheap but it's River North. I had a grilled cheese with a good pickle. Definitely will be back.

Mhm. Sandwiches. Hmm. The process to receive your sandwich is tough. As I got mine right away but my homey waited 20 minutes for his? It wasnt even put in? Weird, star off for that. Cole slaw was good, coffee was meh, sandwich was good. I will round down. Prices are indicative of the $5000 folding chairs they sell next door. Nice if your in the hood but I would not go out of my way.

Aloof staff. Overpriced for mediocre food. I work nearby so I go occasionally. Most people in our office don't even consider it when thinking of places to go for lunch. They must just be banking on  the fact that they're in a relatively isolated location without many decent alternatives because I have to imagine that no one would go if there were better options nearby.
Awesome pumpkin bread, cookie, muffin.  Can't wait to try it again and try a meal.  Staff was great. Coffee was good.
The food is good but MAN this place is a disaster at lunch. I constantly wait 20-30 minutes for food when I brave coming over the lunch hour.

An uber simple sandwich shop serving good fresh food at great prices ($5-$10). BREAKFAST EGG SANDWICH ($5) -- I was expecting the egg salad sandwich.  I was amused that it is 2 eggs on the grill with common fixins in a sandwich.  Just right, balanced and happy BREAD SELECTION -- impressive.  English Muffin, 7 Grain, Wheat...at least 7. VENUE -- clean and organized. SERVICE -- helpful, informative, friendly and gladly accommodates. I look forward to the steak sandwich.

I really really wanted to like this place, super cute and super close to my office. First things first, their prices don't match online and in store, no biggie. So I go in and the guy at the register looks like he wants to be anywhere else. I took my time looking over the menu, as I had never been in before and he acted like I was wasting his time. It's now been about 10 minutes since I had my overpriced, nothing special cheeseburger, and I feel nauseous. Not cool. First and last time.

I used to eat at Brett's EVERY DAY (voluntarily and religiously) when I worked nearby. They have a basic menu with lots of burger / sandwich options. I tried a few, but my personal favorite is the cheeseburger with chipotle sauce and diced jalapeno peppers (you have to ask for the sauce and peppers. Good thing is, they don't charge extra for additional ingredients. And you get a pickle on the side!). I don't know what it is but I've been getting cheeseburgers my entire life at every burger joint I go to and none are quite like how they make it at Brett's. I work on Michigan Ave now, so I don't get to go back as much, but I really miss it and urge everyone to try out this place.

really love this place a lot, it's the perfect for a quick lunch during the work week.  definitely recommend the turkey club! all their food is freshly made right in front of you & their service is fast, thanks to multiple cooks.  great environment with the option to dine in, as well! they've earned their five stars from me.

It's similar to a diner, or back in Metro Detroit, a coney. Order up at the counter and pick up when they call your number. I got a cheeseburger with french fries. Loved the french fries; they were crispy and seasoned just right. Cheeseburger was heavy on the condiments, and similar to any burger that you would get at McDonald's. Nothing to rave about on that end. Walked out of there paying $11, so not exactly cheap, but still okay. That being said, I'd come back if I was looking for a quick meal before classes if I was in the mood.

In River North, you don't get too many fast casual spots so I am especially thankful for Brett's! They have the best iced coffee and their food is so delicious! I love grabbing one of their breads to go after I eat there so I can snack on it while I am "on the go" Try their oatmeal - amazing!!!!!!!
This place is the best if you are looking for home style lunch! The staff is super friendly!  Thank you, Brett's Kitchen for making Vegetarian soup today! It's Delicious!
This place is great! We love the food. The staff are nice and the prices are pretty good for River North.

Disappointing Glop. I was looking forward to the turkey burger from Brett's, even at $9. I didn't realize a turkey burger would be served on a pita--no mention of that on the menu or when ordering. Also no mention of the brussel sprouts and copious amount of creamy Italian dressing. So much sickly, sweet dressing that the pita bread fell apart. It was a messy, disappointing pile of glop. The side of sweet potato fries was burnt. Unedible. Maybe I should have ordered the $7 cup of chili instead?

I've been here a few times as literally, a last resort. The general vicinity is a food desert with most food establishments being at least a half mile away. And who wants to walk in sub zero temps to McDonalds on Ohio Street or deal with the zombies on Chicago Ave. Yeah, that's okay, I'll wait. Didn't think so.  So for a quick stop within a 1-2 block radius, this place meets a need. However, my experience today further underscored why I don't go often.  For those new to the area, this is a diner-like atmosphere. With a grill and two to three people working the grill.   When considering cost, quality and service - there is much to be desired. Service has been consistently poor. They have a ticket process.  When you place and pay for an order, you are given a number that is included in a ticket. The order feeds to a ticket machine that the cooks (they are by NO stretch of any imagination - chefs) pull to begin preparing your meal. Naturally, 11:00 a.m. -1:00 p.m. is part of the lunch hour and the busiest. I came in AFTER the lunch crowd. Placed and paid for an order and then began to wait. Waited some more. Waited more. While another customer's spouse ate half a sandwich and THEN realized it was chicken and not tuna as she had ordered -__-  They prepared her another sandwich, this one with tuna.  And again, I waited. And after 40 minutes got part of my order while they waited on fries. Really. 40 minutes for a simple sandwich. And the cook acted like he was irritated with me for having a different ticket number than the order he prepared for someone else who - obviously gave up waiting.  This is not the first time they've either ignored my ticket that came through the machine or pretended that there was a mix up with the register.  No. The mix up is with the cooks behind the counter.  I can go into any number of reasons why this occurred but will leap to solutions. 1. Improve the back end process of how orders are received by the cooks. Either have a crew chief who directs what orders are handled by who OR 2. Set up an electronic system that projects the next order on a display screen. But I guess I'd have to walk the green mile to McDonalds for that.

I needed something cheap and quick, so I figured I'd give Brett's Kitchen a try. The staff is nice, though I couldn't quite achieve my goal of "cheap", grabbing a tuna sandwich and sweet potato fries for a bit over $11. The sandwich was quite good; it was relatively large, the tuna salad was of good quality and I liked the freshness of the vegetables. The fries, though, were pretty much unseasoned and I noticed it wasn't altogether crunchy. The wait was modest (~20 minutes) which was good--it means your food is going to be coming out fresh. I'm willing to give it another shot, though, and call my order in next time.
Great place to stop in for coffee and breakfast. Very friendly staff and good food.

First time visit for breakfast. We had the cheddar n chive omlet and a bacon egg bagel sammie. It was delicious. And the service was outstanding. Extremely friendly staff and quick turnaround. HIGHLY recommend!!!

When I got here, they told me 'the grill is turned off' - which is a little weird in the middle of the day. The only thing they had was cold sandwiches. I paid $7 for a cold turkey sandwich with turkey meat that was worse than super market bought. I also asked for mustard - and instead of putting it on the sandwich they put a couple packets in the bag. I expected better service and better food. I understand it's the holiday season, but they should have their grill turned on at all times.

TERRIBLE SERVICE! I ordered a veggie and turkey sandwich and got all the way back to my job to find they didn't put turkey in (a mistake on their behalf and I was charged for turkey on top of it all). When I called to let them know of the mishap they explained that I can walk all the way back to the store to get the turkey put on. When I told them that I would also like a refund for the inconvenience they refused and said they could only offer me the turkey. I am not sure how this place survives with the service I was provided today. Not to mention I was offered no apology and the soup and sandwich were bland and unsatisfying.  If I could give this place negative stars I would! I advise everyone to stay away!

Food's decent. The ordering experience, not so much. Ordered by phone from the online menu, an albacore tuna sandwich for $5.75.  When I got there, the guy noticed (to his credit) that they'd made it with the wrong bread and had it corrected. When he asked for his money, he quoted $7.50, which I paid. I turned to leave and it suddenly occurred to me that wasn't the price listed on their site. I returned to the counter, politely pointed that out, and he motioned to the overhead blackboard and said $7.50 was the price listed there. I replied that wasn't the price listed on the site I'd ordered from, and if it was I wouldn't have ordered it. He replied with an intelligible grunt and a shrug -- no amends offered whatsoever. Not good.

This place is great.  Very conveniently located, and they have a terrific selection.  The burgers are really great, as are all of the sandwiches, such as the BLT, Turkey Club, and Chicken Salad AND they have some of my favorite fries.  I frequent here often.

Love this place! It has a great atmosphere and really good food. I highly recommend the BLT (w/avocado) and Sweet potato Fries. This meal is delicious. Also, the Staff is very friendly. I have been coming here for years and will continue to!

I go here like twice a week at least! Everyone is super friendly. There isn't too much seating, but I usually go around 1-2pm and I can get a spot to sit. There's outdoor seating when it's nice out.  Not a big fan of the salmon burger...I think the salmon is frozen. I always get the BLT with avocado and fries. The sweet potato fries are delicious! Great lunch spot.

It's directly outside of the southern exit (on Superior St) of the Chicago brown line stop.  Solid lunch selection, but when I worked nearby I'd sometimes stop in on my way to work for a "western omelet sandwich on 7-grain with cheese."  And then share half with a coworker.  So good, but so much food!  Friendly but no nonsense staff.

The time on my receipt after I paid was 12:09.  I walked out with my food at 12:45.  That is after I asked twice on the status!  I've been here numerous times and have always come back even though the wait is longer than most places since there's not too many carryout sandwich spots by my office.  But this was the last straw today.  The staff has no system for orders and is not helpful.  Other patrons were just as frustrated.  Not worth it for the time, headache and frankly overpriced lunch.

Came in here on a whim for breakfast this morning and I'm sure glad I did. I went with the breakfast special and subbed in hash browns for eggs. I was really impressed that the cashier was willing to do this because many places are not willing (I do not eat eggs, so I encounter this a lot).  The special came with two pancakes, bacon and hash browns. I got a heaping plate of food for $7.75 and was really impressed with the portions for the price. Pancakes - perfectly cooked, very fluffy and just all around great  Bacon - could have been a little crispier but was pretty good Hash browns - These were a real home run. They were really seasoned, perfectly cooked and totally shocking for what I thought I'd find in this little corner joint. The hash browns alone are worth another trip All in all Brett's Kitchen really impressed me. They know what they do and do it very well at an affordable price. I'd definitely bring friends back for breakfast or go back to try it for lunch.

The sandwiches are delicious and creative. A Mediterranean Chicken sandwich with tabbouleh on pita? Yum!  A Mexican Chicken sandwich with avocado? Yes, please! Apparently, if you love chicken sandwiches, this is the place to be. Not to mention their tortilla soup and chocolate chip cookies.  The staff is friendly and speedy and while there's nowhere to sit during the busy weekday lunch hour, if the weather is hospitable, go up the street to the park or over to the river and eat outside. The fresh air is good for you!

Fast, fresh, and reliable!  Anything I have tried from Brett's has never disappointed me from the donuts to the sandwiches.  I heard they make a killer omelette as well but I have yet to have the time to try them! The iced coffee is my favorite menu item...nice and strong with lots of ice :) The entire staff: the cashiers AND the cooks are very friendly.  Way to go, Brett's!

Very nice staff and solid lunch options. I personally don't always want to pay more than $8-$10 for a sandwich, so I don't come often. But at least they put fresh avocado slices on their offerings, and only ever make the fries when you order them so they're always hot and crispy. That classifies as A-OK in my book.

Lunch has been good, which is what's saving Brett's from 2 stars here. However, if you say you serve breakfast 'till 11:30, serve breakfast 'till 11:30. I've now been denied on two separate occasions at 11:15. Have yet to actually try the breakfast. Maybe next time..

Pretty simple sando shop. They're not gonna make you yearn to come back on the food alone, but the service is really quick and they do it with a smile.  I had the Mexican Chicken, which was a little more chicken than it was Mexican. Light on spices, but the avocado was fresh and so were the other fixens. Definitely wouldn't shove the elderly out of the way to get another, but for a quick bite when I was in the area for a meeting it did the trick.  There's lots of offices around here so if you're in one of them it's not a bad option, but as far as driving in from Oak Park just to go to Brett's kitchen I don't think I would.

If I was in the area for anything I would come here. The place is super small with a handful of tables but it seems like the crowd is office workers who order their lunch and go. Regulars abound but if you're not one you don't get iced out or mean mugged. You get the same quick and friendly counter service and sure you can get an Egg Salad sandwich or a burger but they have some pretty interesting options like a Mexican chicken sandwich which is a treat. If you're there to sit down though it may be difficult to get a table and if there's more than two in your group your seat choices will be further limited.  Just don't show up for an office outing and it will be a treat.

I work just down the road from this place, and never stopped in. I usually go to Galleria for lunch, and thought I'd give this place a try. I ordered the tuna salad sandwich and their Soup of the Day, Chicken Tortilla. The food was ready within 2 minutes, but the chef decided to make an omelet, warm up some biscuits before placing my sandwich and soup into a bag for me. There wasn't a line, it wasn't during the lunch hour, so there was no reason for the 10 minute delay. I brought the food back to work and dove into the soup. The small soup costs about $4.50, which is pretty pricey in my eyes, and the size was pretty standard, about fist high and palm wide. The soup wasn't bad, although the chicken was flavorless and incredibly dry tasting. The tortillas were pre-added to the batch, so they were already soggy, not the texture I expected. As for the sandwich...it was terrible. The piece of lettuce was all dried up and and on the verge of spoiled. The tuna salad was some of the driest I've had, and completely lacked flavor. To through more insult to injury, the tuna didn't even cover the surface of the bread, almost 1/3 of the bread top to bottom was missing tuna salad...and they gave me two (2) quarter sized tomatoes', 1/4" thick, stacked on top of each other right in the middle. It's not difficult, especially for a deli, to make decent tuna salad, spread it across the entire bread, have some fresh lettuce, and two normal sized 2" tomato slices spread across the area of the sandwich. This wasn't just bad, it was lazy...and it all cost me $12.50. What a ripoff! I don't know how the rest of their food is, but unfortunately this bad experience will prevent me from finding out.

Cute place, great and diverse menu. The sandwiches are the same price as other places in the neighborhood, but not quite as huge, which might be positive or negative depending on your hunger levels :)

Pretty decent coffee, sandwich, breakfast shop. I went here on a Saturday for a healthy bite to eat.  I got the portabello mushroom sandwich.  It was good, it wasnt anything amazing BUT it was good and only like $6 or something.  I love that they put sprouts on it.  Such small things can make me happy. It looks like they have a great selection of breakfast items and other hearty sandwiches.  They also have a case of pastries, breads, etc.
Maybe shame on me for ordering a coffee drink here, but their espresso machine looked legit so I gave it a shot.  Shoot and a miss.

I wish I could give zero stars for this place.  I must say the lady at the front who takes your order is very nice and accommodating, but the person who is in charge of the kitchen is beyond rude.  I picked up my order and took it out to eat it.  When I realized the order wasn't right I went back in to explain I had been given the wrong sandwich.  She fought with me back and forth insisting it was what I ordered.  Not sure how that goes considering I don't even eat meat and that is what I received.  Needless to say I finally got what I paid for but it was not without a fight and she made a huge scene in front of many others who were there in the lunchtime rush.  When I was leaving, someone else was walking in saying too they got something they didn't order.  Hmmm.....

I went to Brett's over lunch one day because I wanted to try something new. It was pretty busy, but I felt they were getting sandwiches out pretty slowly. Everything is open so you can watch them while you're waiting for your food, but I wish I hadn't. Granted I am a vegetarian and it bothered me that they didn't have a designated "meat" and "non-meat" section on their grill, but more than that, they were cross-contaminating like crazy! I think anyone should be concerned when they use the same spatula to flip a raw chicken breast and then flip a piece of toast. Someone took my food even though everyone is given a ticket with a number so I ended up waiting much longer for my food. In the end, the sandwich was pretty good (good enough for its price? not sure). I got the pesto special and I liked that everything was homemade and not mass-produced. But the service, wait, and lack of sanitary measures turned me off. There are better sandwich places in River North.

I stopped in for the first time today thanks to my new office location, and so far so good! I only had the tabouleh, but I willingly accepted a bite from a co-workers reuben and it was pretty damn good. Everything seemed fresh and the bread was sufficiently buttery crisp.  The tuna melt, turkey burger and sweet potato fries looked solid too. I feel a little guilty that I'm more excited about the new food options than my pristine window seat at the office, but I can't help my foodie behavior. The prices are slightly steep, but I don't mind the long wait or the feisty service behind the counter. It's a quaint spot that I'm sure I'll frequent often.

I work right off the Chicago Brown line and I always see Brett's Kitchen. I finally tried it last week and was pleasantly surprised! The only reason for a 4-star rating is because of the phone etiquette when I called to order. The woman answered by saying, "Yeah?" When I said I wanted to place an order for pickup, she responded with, "Yeah what do'ya want?" I felt this was a little rude, especially because I called around 2:00, not during busy lunch hour. I ordered the Pyrenees Cheese Sandwich with avocado and tabouli. I'll try anything with avocado! I wasn't sure what tabouli was, but it seemed sort of like quinoa. I spent about $7 on the sandwich and sweet potato fries. Both were excellent (although the fries were a bit soggy. Still good, though!) While I got my lunch to go, the inside of the restaurant was very clean and quaint, set up like a diner. Good to know there's a restaurant near my work that's decently priced with good food!
4 stars only because the one time I went with co-workers, our sandwiches took quite awhile. But I like the variety on the menu and the grilled chicken sandwich I had was fantastic!

The prices here are a little steep as others have mentioned.  I've come here for a few things so far. One, the parfait. That is the one awesome thing I've had at Brett's so far. There are two layers of not-too-sweet yogurt, a middle layer of crunchy, fresh granola, and topped with 4-5 fresh berries. It's yummy and delicious, but it costs $4.  I've also gotten the egg sandwich, which really was not worth the $4. The bread doesn't taste buttered or like anything special. And the eggs, although freshly cooked, was dry and didn't have much flavor. I definitely would not be getting that sandwich again. I've also bought a piece of pound cake, which was a huge piece, but way too buttery. But on a huge plus side, everyone there is friendly esp the cashier, and everyone who goes into that place looks happy. I bet their lunch sandwiches taste better.

Came here for lunch on a whim. Very reasonably priced given the area and the Reuben I had was delicious. Lines at lunch never seem to get terribly long even though there is not much lunch-wise around the area and I enjoyed the casual diner atmosphere.

I've actually never been to Brett's for lunch because I don't work in the area. But I live 3 blocks away and frequent there for breakfast on Saturdays.  I love it here!  So quiet and comfortable, and the food is great. It's nothing mind blowing but for the price and what they have it's perfect for a quick cheap breakfast. Lastly their HOMEMADE HOT SAUCE is the best!!!!...try it

I work close to here and it's my favorite lunch spot. I love the grilled chicken on rye! Everything they offer is delicious. Some of the negative reviews complain about the wait time but I don't remember ever having to wait more than 5-10 minutes... the food is made to order, it's not McDonald's by any means so it's not going to be ready in ten seconds (which is a good thing). It's also not expensive at all! The sandwiches are all in the $4-6 range which is WAY cheaper than surrounding places. This is River North, nothing is dirt cheap here. Quality ingredients for a great price. Don't believe the haters.

I don't know what the hype is about this place. I've been here twice and both times was not impressed with the food. I'm more unimpressed with the service which is always, slow, rude and overall annoying. Today I came in and tried ordering a French Toast to go and it took almost 20 minutes. I was the only customer along with a red headed girl that may have worked at a different location? She kept going back and forth about hot beverage sleeves and it took FOREVER. UGH, do that on your own time and don't take up mine. I was so annoyed I couldn't wait to get out of there. Once I had a few bites of my French Toast I was more annoyed as it didn't even taste good, there is not enough butter or syrup in the world to make this edible. Luckily, I saw a homeless person and was able to give it to someone in need. I will never go back.

Been meaning to try this sandwich shop since I started working down the block. Had the chicken salad sandwich on a pita - it was perfectly portioned and super fresh. The proportion of mayo to the rest of the sandwich was appropriate: not sloppy or dry. Everything is made to order, so there's a bit of a wait after you place your order; but obviously it's worth it. So many different kinds of sandwiches, including melts and burgers, breads to choose from, etc.  They make their own baked goods, too - so snag a cookie, brownie, or piece of their breakfast breads in the morning. There is seating inside, but not a lot - so don't expect to dine-in during your lunch hour. Some people have complained it's "expensive" - $5-$8 is the cost for a sandwich, $2.25 for a baked good. It's really okay, people. This isn't mystery meat at Subway.

Best diner in the city. The staff are friendly and reliable. They always think up creative and healthy lunch specials. If you have a chance to go to Bretts please do - we go nearly every day for lunch!

Love this place.  Love the friendly people that work there, love the food, love the atmosphere, free wi-fi and outdoor seating area in the summer.  Their coffee is awesome and their breakfast is good (I mean, you can get pancakes/bacon/eggs/the works!).  Just watch what time you go there for lunch - it gets packed right around noon!

As a River North lunchtime institution, Brett's kitchen is a clean, cozy, and of course, a tasty little place to get a nice fresh sandwich to your liking. Very busy during weekdays at lunch but worth dealing with the crowd.   I love Brett's Kitchen!

We stopped by this place on Thanksgiving weekend when our original destination was closed for the holiday. It is a cute little diner with a fairly large menu. I ordered one of the specials - A Mexican breakfast burrito, which was quite good. My companion ordered the grilled cheese because people on Yelp mentioned that it was good. But let me tell you, it is not good. It was made with Craft Singles! Why would you have a grilled cheese sandwich on your menu if you're going to make it with Craft Singles? We were shocked! The "cheese" wasn't even melted all the way and it was nasty. The real kicker was that after we got our food we noticed on the menu board that they have imported cheeses! I bet the sandwich would have been good with some real cheese, but they didn't ask what kind of cheese we wanted or even ask us if Craft Singles would be OK. That lousy sandwich ruined the experience for us. The fries are as average as can be (think Perkins' fries).

Went here for a late lunch today with the gf for a couple of sandwiches and something for dessert.  Ended up getting a corned beef sandwich on grilled rye bread with coleslaw and russian dressing.  Surprisingly it was really better then I had expected. My gf had the turkey club and it was good as well.  The cookies were above average, had a chocolate chip and oatmeal raisin.   The staff was very nice, and they didn't charge extra for everything I wanted put on my sandwich which is nice considering what most places end up charging.  I do not think anything was particularly amazing, but it was all very good, for lack of a better word.  I will definitely be back here again.

Trust me, SKIP SUBWAY and walk a few more steps down. I work a few blocks away Brett's, and its my favorite. The staff is so genuine and friendly. I have such a crush on the girl that cashiers! After visiting only a few times, it felt like she recognized me and we were buds. Love that! The whole team acts like family. Its such good energy, laughing, joking, smiling always.  The place is really clean, and has this cute rustic charm with colored bowls around the walls, that is hard to find in the city. The food is fantastic. I am never disappointed. You dont even have to look at the menu, whatever you want, they can make it, and it will have fresh ingredients and you feel totally catered to. HIGH quality food and service at a totally reasonable price, done quick for us 30-min lunchers. LOVE IT!

I work a few blocks away from this deli/sandwich shop, and it really is as good as it gets for a quick lunch spot.  The staff is genuinely friendly -- after visiting only a few times, I felt that I was recognized, and the cashier jokes around with me often while she is taking my order.  If the staff isn't a family, they sure act like it. Everyone in there is happy and working together to run an efficient operation. the place is really clean, too. The food is fantastic. I probably eat here once or twice a week, and I am never disappointed. I'm never wary to try something off the menu that i haven't ordered before, but my favorite menu item is the Gazpacho, which they serve all summer -- the BLT and hamburger are also mighty tasty, but the menu has plenty of healthy and/or vegetarian options too. I feel that Brett's takes great care to serve high quality food that is very fresh -- from the bread to the cold cuts to the lettuce on top, it couldn't be better. it's a million miles ahead of the soggy tomatoes in that plastic bin down the street at Subway. Sorry, Subway.

the only reason I'm giving this place 2 stars is for the atmosphere. it is too bad that the food isn't better as it would be a great place to go.  it's right off the chicago brown line stop and near galleries so it's a great location. but the food! I ordered a grilled portabella on a pita and  the hummus was oozing out of it and not all of the ingredients were even in the pita.  On another time, I ordered a grilled turkey sandwich and it wasn't grilled all of the way and the turkey was very dry.  Just a miserable experience for the price.   what is worse is that you leave with a smell that stays on you for a long while! I work nearby and my coworkers can always tell by the scent when someone has been to brette's.  we will not recommend guests to the place and I will only go again if I am desperate.  Maybe I should try the grilled cheese, because if that really is as good as other yelpers say, then it may be one good reason to go. :)
Been eating here a few times and the food comes out just the same. Great fish tacos on fridays only!
great diner  for lunch.  friendly staff, reasonable prices
Brett's makes a great coffee.  Easily 2x better than the swill at SBUX!

A quick update on Brett's, which has become my number one lunch location in River North. Here are some insider tips from a regular: The daily special is always rotating, and the only thing that is set in stone is Thursday, which is always Sloppy Joe day - the best day of the whole week! I go every Thursday, and I love it so much I even created a little song and dance that I sing when I order "It's Sloppy Joe Day Mother Truckas." The staff humors me with this, and even asked for their picture with me, when I came in wearing the "It's Sloppy Joe Day Mother Trucka" t-shirt my co-workers had custom made for my birthday.  I usually get my Joe with the fries, but occasionally will get it with the coleslaw, and just dump the slaw right on the sandwich, adding a cool, crispy crunch.  I also have been known to top my Joe with cheddar cheese and a bag of Fritos I snag at Walgreens next door. If I get the urge for Brett's on a non-Thursday, I usually opt for "the Dago." This non-menu item is the specialty of the line cook Dago (pronounced Dah-go, and hopefully spelled right. I know that this spelling is also how you spell the ethnic slur, which is absolutely NOT what I am going for.)  it is basically a Mexican chicken sandwich, with a twist. You can also order his breakfast sandwich, which is pretty good too. Their 1/2 pound cheese burger is currently my favorite hamburger in town (next to Kuma's, which to be fair shouldn't really be compared to a regular burger anyway since it usually has so many unconventional ingredients piled on top!).  It is just a delicious, no frills, mouth-watering, delicious burger. My boss and I get these about once a month, eat it so fast it's like swallowing it whole, and then go into a beef coma for the rest of the day. Also, I want to confirm the other reviews - the Banana bread is shockingly good. Very moist and delicious! Well worth it. The only downside to Brett's is that their close time of 4PM is a bit deceptive. There have been a number of times I've stopped by or called in an order around 3:30 and they've told me their grill is shut down for the day.

I go to Brett's Kitchen on a regular basis and have enjoyed most food from there.  Everything seems really fresh and usually tastes good!!  The staff is really friendly as well!  The only gripe I have about this place.....it can be overpriced and the newest member working the cashier station is PAINFULLY SLOW.  It's like watching someone in slow motion as he rings people up.  We need our old friend back working the register!!!  She was so much more efficient and got you out the door in no time!  The time I spend there in the mornings has now doubled since they switched their staff around. :(
I've eaten lunch here several times.  Their sandwiches are consistently good.  I recommend the turkey club or the Reuben.

i've been back several times since my last review and i have become a 'regular'.  their blueberry muffins have oatmeal in them with loads of blueberries - so soft and yummy! i really like their blt's - perfectly made. all of the homemade soups they make that i've tasted were all very comforting and delicious! also try their chili - another comforting cup of flavor!

Love this place for lunch! I love the cashier lady - she's so fun, and extremely nice.  I had the double quarter pound burger. Definitely hit the spot that day. Juicy and filling! Today, I had the grilled chicken sandwich on french bread - phenom. Just light enough for lunch. The fries are also pretty good too. People recommend the grilled cheese - next time I'm getting me one of those!  River north's lunch spots gets tiring but Brett's kitchen is always a good option! Do it!

Working at 600 West Chicago, my lunch options were wearing me down, so you could imagine how happy I was when some co-workers introduced this place to me. Thank goodness! I've just been here once but there are so many options that I could see this being a long-lasting friendship. My Mediterranean sandwich and fruit bowl was really good, really fresh, and it didn't take me long to get my food... all very important for an office-break-lunch. Yes, Brett, I'll be back.

The food at Brett's is really fresh and the staff is very friendly. I work at a gallery around the corner and go here for lunch at least once a week. It's a little pricey, but the ingredients are always fresh and the daily specials are tasty. It's a really small space, and they serve everything on the line, so you have to pay attention to your order number when its up, which I have noticed confuses newbies. I'm rarely in the area early enough, but the breakfast special is great, and the lattes, which they have all day, are much more affordable than the Starbucks down the street. I really like the Vegetarian Special, served on pita, and the Mediterranean Chicken Sandwich, which is served with tabouli. The fries are thick and sometimes soggy, so I would skip those, but everything else is on spot.

The staff is great at this place.  I often order black coffee in the mornings and enjoy it!  I ordered a grilled cheese- it wasn't as good as a hamburger would have been (at the same price).  I do realize that this 3-star review is entirely my fault for ordering such a bullsh*t attempt at a sandwich. I should have asked for a different cheese on my grilled cheese, perhaps one of the artisan cheeses that they promote would have been better than the standard, blase, cheddar. If you take anything away from this short review, please do not get cheddar cheese on anything that you'll order. And I couldn't find a bathroom, isn't a restaurant required to have a bathroom?  Maybe its not required (?) as they might only have seating for about 15-20 people.

The prices are right, the staff is really great & my sandwich was awesome! The only reason it's getting only 4 stars is because of limited seating. However... don't let that stop you!!!!! Get a sandwich to go & enjoy! I had the grilled Portobello mushroom sandwich! Wow! They got it down! Some places end up with a soggy sandwich due to the high water content and the mushroom "sweating" it out when cooked. Brett's understands mushrooms!  This place is definitely on my lunchtime rotation.

The pulp-heavy fresh-squeezed orange juice here is deeeeelicious! It's $3.50 for a medium-sized plastic cup, but it's worth every penny. Service is super-sweet, and this is also a very family-friendly place - seems like a rarity out here in River North in the gallery district. Next time I come back, I'm going to take Jelena's advice and try the tuna melt, mmm...
I would give this restaurant 5 stars based on their chocolate chip cookies alone but the sandwiches kick ass as well.  YUM!

This is a neighborhood deli -- no more, no less. I really don't understand why so many people seem to love it on this site. I work nearby and go there for convenience. It's fine. I'm glad it's there. But three quarters of my colleagues won't go there because it's overpriced, unorganized and portions can be underwhelming (particularly the daily specials).  To be fair, their muffins, pound cakes and fruit breads are really good.
This place is close to my office so I eat there often. The specials are usually good but the service is slow, portions are small, and I feel like you pay high end deli prices for low end food.

A friend introduced me to this place a few days ago and this is now a staple in my diet after I finish a Bikram yoga class (the studio is right around the corner and I'm always famished afterward). I've had several of their soups, including the broccoli cream, chicken and rice, and the turkey chili. The made to order sandwiches have all been quickly prepared and loaded up with ingredients that are very fresh. The coffee is great, they have a nice little selection of tea, and plenty of cold beverages to wet your whistle. And to boot, a great staff! Check it out if you haven't!

This place is around the corner from our office which is why I go, but I love it. The girl behind the counter is always there (always meaning every morning on the 3 times I've come to Chi for work) and is very quick and friendly.  She does the coffees and teas too and doesn't disappoint. The portions and quality of breakfast ingredients are fantastic.  I don't normally like BREAKFAST POTATOES because they are never cooked well and usually just covered in pepper.  These I like.  They are slices and have great flavor. I don't know what it is, but it's yummy.   I like my EGGS over-medium and the cook is dead on with this. PANCAKES, yum.   EGG SANDWICH, yum. FRESH OJ, yum. The music in Brett's is fantastic.  I would like to get a hold of their ipod because it played some great songs I knew and some ones I wanted to know.  It made breakfast that much better. No Starbucks or searching for Dunkin while I am here or eating at the hotel.  Brett's is the place.

They're only open until 4pm - which threw me off when I'd walk by there after work on my way to the train. Literally, every day I'd press my face to the window and wonder if it was just vacant or something and the thought NEVER occured to me that there wasn't even a "For Rent" sign in the window so maybe it WASN'T vacant. Guys, it's not vacant. I'm just retarded and unable to figure out when it's open. S-M-R-T. Anyway, it's a lovely little sandwich/breakfast/coffee shop that's only open til 4 and makes a damn tasty tuna melt. I paid a little more than I would have liked for said tuna melt (considering a can of tuna at Dominicks tends to be $1, and bread is maybe $2 for a loaf), but I also could have brought my lunch so maybe I should shut up, huh?

A cute lunch spot that is totally out of place for the gallery district - I'd expect this to be sandwiched between two stores in Lincoln Park, never River North. I had an almond croissant that was slightly overpriced at $2, but still delicious.

i don't know how anyone can say a bad thing about this place. the food is always the freshest -- best fresh food -- and it's tasty. for those of you complaining about the crowd; if a place is consistently crowded it's usually for good reason. the food is great. plus, their service is awesome; even when crowded, they get you in and out in about ten minutes. i'll wait ten minutes for fresh, great food any day. as for price, it's totally reasonable. you get what you pay for. this place is a mainstay; been there for so long. in fact, when i had my first job out of college in 97, i went there daily. now, nearly 15 years later, i am working back in the neighborhood and i am so thrilled to have Brett's back. highlights: BLT, tuna, all the sweets, especially the bread and god damn it, they get good coffee. i could never ask for more. i go there almost everyday.

I'm a fish and fowl kinda gut and I also LOVE breakfast. This place is HEAVEN for me. It's just a little 6 table bakery styled shop.  They've got tables outside as well but it's all very casual.  The turkey chili caught my eye bur upon further inspection  I noticed they had salmon burgers, gazpacho and curry turkey on wheat. With great burgers  and a slew of healthy vegetarian choices, along with great coffee drinks and some tasty looking baked goods all moderately priced and served quickly, this place has now become a Chicago staple for me already.  I came in for a quick cup of coffee and left with a place to tuck in my mealtime napkin.

Ok, this joint has decent veggie burgers, a solid breakfast sandwich, and a quality selection of breads, chips, drinks, etc...but the biggest plus is the staff...especially Adrian...she's a friggin' gem!  It's a little pricey, but if you're in the area, it's not a bad look...

Tried out Brett's Kitchen today for the first time. I was walking by and it looked cute so I stopped in. Bright, cute cafe. It was pretty crowded but the line moved fast. I got a Mediterranean sandwich - grilled pita, grilled chicken, tabbouleh, lettuce & yogurt sauce - and it was really good.

YUCK!!!!!  I've given this place many chances only because its the closest place for lunch. Every time I try something different hoping it would get better, but to no dice! Tried the tuna - tasteless, turkey sandwich- nothing special at all. The final draw was when i ordered a simple Bacon Egg and Cheese on toast for breakfast. Not only were they slow with hardly any customers, but when i got to work and opened my sandwich would you believe they had the NERVE to give me BURNT TOAST!!!! Now how in the world can i eat a BURNT Toast Sandwich...everything will taste burnt. I was fuming!!!  So in short spare yourself and don't waste your money!!!

I wish there was a little place like this in the Loop.  If there is, I haven't discovered it amongst all the corner bakeries and chipotles that are ubiquitous. This place is super cute and super yummy and super affordable.  I only went there once and had soup and tabouli but I'll try it again sometime and then I might just have to upgrade to 5 stars!

They were really busy at lunch and therefore messed up my order a tad, but ain't no thang. My chicken sandwich was still good. I wish there were more meat on it though. The atmosphere is really cute. The service is good, and the pricing is average. They do have daily specials which is nice. I need to try something else in order to really make my judgement on this place.

Food is awesome, the staff is great. It can get crowded around lunch time but they know how to keep the line moving. Love the Thursday special: Sloppy Joe with fries - Highly recommend.  Brett's is a great River North lunch spot.

A nice and cozy place for getting away from loading work during lunch break. The service is nice and welcoming.  I had a Tuna melt on Multigrain sandwich. I can taste its fresh and crunchy skin and nicely filling with tuna salad.  What a decent food and cute Italian style of interior design!

In a rush Friday morning, didn't make breakfast, so I'll stop at Brett's Kitchen for some morning fuel. Usually I just grab a bagel with cream cheese which will only set you back $2.25 which I can handle but this time... ... I'll have an egg, bacon, and cheese sandwich with an OJ. Fresh squeezed or bottled? Fresh squeezed (its payday, why not?). That will be $9.00, and I almost felt obligated to tip, so 10 bucks out the door. Yikes! I will pay the convenience fee because it's literally under the Chicago and Franklin Brown Line stop and on my way to work.  And don't get me wrong the food is very good and they crank it out in the morning. I've had the turkey club for lunch as well, at $6.75 with no sides; I haven't been back for lunch (maybe because there is a Subway within spitting distance of me). If price is not an issue then you will find superior home-made food, friendly staff, and they cook on a flat top right in front of you. If you stop in enough they will start to remember your order - if you can afford it (I think the price comes with the territory). Oh and they have a lot of pre-made sandwiches, muffins, and breakfast fare, etc. if that's for you. I was torn between 3 and 4 stars but price knocked it down.

Stopped here for a quick bite to eat and it was just what were looking for. I had a delicious Reuben sandwich and tried the tuna salad sandwich was also really tasty. I had a bowl of the carrot dill soup which the lady over the counter recommended and now I want the recipe! Good place to go if you're in a hurry or just don't want to deal with being served.

This place is right around the block from my work.  The service is great and usually pretty fast.  Their grilled chicken is always flavorful and moist.  My favorite special is the fish tacos...perfectly seasoned with a side of mango salsa. The breakfast is awesome and sometimes they will break the rules and make you an egg & cheese sandwich after 11am (they stop serving breakfast at that time). The banana bread is probably the best I have ever had.  It is moist on the inside with random chunks of bananas and crusty on the outside.  Second favorite is the apple-orange bread with tiny pieces of apples and a hint of orange zest.  They cut big pieces so it's perfect to share with a friend after your meal!

I work across the street so I eat here pretty often!  I've tried most of their sandwiches and they've all been good.  The "pre-made" turkey and chicken sandwiches in the case are also good and they're fresh.   I like the fact that the veggies they put on their sandwiches always seem really fresh.  They usually have a lunch special that is too good to pass up.  My guilty pleasure lunch is the grilled cheese with tomatoes and french fries.... yummy.
Go early for lunch because it gets crowded fast. I love all of the sandwiches (I've tried most of them.)  Club sandwich is always a go-to order for me. And the staff is always nice.

I really like Brett's Kitchen.  The food is really good, the atmosphere is cute and the staff are super friendly.  It's an adorable little diner. With that said, there are a few down sides.  One thing is that they are a little pricey... not crazy, especially given the location, but I always feel like I'm paying 1 or 2 dollars more than I should be.   The second thing is that it is REALLY REALLY small.  From noon - 1 the wait can be moderate and seating very tough to find.  If they added a little outdoor seating for the spring/summer it would be lovely, but as of right now they do not have outdoor seating.   Easy fix for the tight squeeze is to go on slightly off times.  I've gone at 11:30am or 1:00pm and had no problem finding a table.

I went wedding dress shopping with a friend in the area to help her find "the dress."  In between appointments, we stopped by to grab a quick snack.  I got their banana bread. . . a thick slice, which was extremely moist and the perfect consistency of banana-ness to it.  After looking at the boutiques, we stopped back again for lunch.  By this time it was early afternoon on a Saturday.  To my luck, they were still offering the breakfast menu. . . which made me extremely happy!  I ordered their chorizo omlette, which I added some tobacco sauce for a nice kick factor.  The hash browns were delish.  I liked how the items weren't as greasy and good portion-control sizes.  This place was decorated so cutely with their array of colorful mixing bowls, which were placed on top of a shelf along the upper perimeter of their cafe.  The cashier was really sweet too.

I work nearby and we go to Brett's about once a week.  Their menu prices and food are pretty average for the type of restaurant.  The staff their is really friendly and the cashier is always fun to talk to.  I've had the vegetarian special with turkey and the smoked turkey on wheat.  The veggie special I ordered was wrong at first (didn't come with the turkey), but they fixed it without any questions.   The one thing that would push my rating up a star is if the sandwiches were a little bigger.

I just discovered Brett's and I'm kicking myself it took so long! Great coffee and one of the best BLT's (get the avocado with it) in the city. Nice family run business. Not something you see everyday in RIver North so they have my business!

I love this place!!  The staff is great - always cracking jokes, smiling and super friendly with the customers.  Food is great - it's a little high priced for a deli spot but I'm willing to pay it because I've never had a bad thing here. The portions are perfect sized and the daily specials are always good.  They never have a problem modifying anything on their menu upon request.  My favorite is their vegetarian soup!  That and the grilled cheese is simply divine!

This place has eluded me for years.  I go here for coffee now and again, maybe sometimes a muffin too.  But I just don't get why the breakfast sandwiches aren't that good, they take forever to put together an egg sandwich and its plain overpriced for what it is. I'll go back out of pure convenience but wish they'd step their game up.

I was searching for a place for lunches around the River West area and came across Brett's Kitchen.  While it's small (about 5 small tables), it's never been a problem for me finding a seat.  Most lunch goers order their food to go. I've only had their corned beef sandwich, on rye with mustard and a tabouli salad.  The corned beef is tastey.  Not the best I've had (that would be Manny's in South Loop).  But it is better than average.  You get a decent amount of meat.  The tabouli is kinda blah.  Lots of cracked wheat.  I prefer mine with much less cracked wheat.  But it's a filler for those days when I'm starving. I like the girl who takes your order and works the register.  She always greet people with an "hola!" and calls me "babe".  Kinda funny and always catches me off-guard.  But gives the place a feeling of familiarity, like I've been eating there for ages.
Best blueberry muffins EVER. Large crispy tops, and tons of fat fresh berries. The people there are friendly and the food is consistantly good, as are their coffee drinks. Great B-fast spot!

Went here for an early lunch the other day. It was 11 am so the place was pretty empty, just one other guy enjoying some food. The place was small but seated 15 people maybe and it had a cool vibe. Have heard that it can get really busy during lunch so 11 seemed like a great time to beat the rush. I took a moment to look over the menu but I knew what I wanted before I even walked in... I wanted to try the reuben. The menu was impressive, a large selection with plenty of vegetarian options, they also feature some daily soups. The reuben was about $7 which isn't too bad for a sandwich these days. A couple of guys at the grill quickly put my reuben together and before I knew it I was sitting down for a solid lunch. The reuben was good, not the best one in the city or even the loop but a good one.  Personally I think Eppy's or Paramount Room has a better reuben for just as good of a price. If I'm over near Brett's again I'll give it a try. They had a great menu, at a good price and friendly service. But I don't think I'll be going back for the reuben anytime soon.

Nestled below the tracks, Brett's kitchen has this square topped blueberry muffin with a taste that drives the girlfriend wild.  Coffees pretty good and girls/guys behind the counter always very helpful.  So yea, you should hit it, I do.

Good reuben. That's all I had. It was toasted which was a nice change. But not the best reuben in town by any means. The place is small and quaint. We were in and out, but I guess during peak hours it gets pretty busy. Kind of reminds me of a place you'd find in Greenwich Village. I'd like to try their breakfast sometime when I'm in the area.

Another good River North Runch spot! There are some days when you are in the mood for bland repeatable franchise food, and there are days when you want something more, without having pay an arm and a leg. Good selection of sandwiches, grilled stuff, daily soups, and things like coleslaw or potato salad. I usually try going a little bit earlier than lunch, or a bit after. Nothing against standing in lines, but I'd rather be elsewhere. Just like any decent location, nicer weather makes for longer lines.

I LOVE this place! Adriana waited on us at the cash register and couldn't have been sweeter. She was friendly and helpful. The room was bright and clean. The menu was huge. I can't wait to go back and try something else. It's a coffee shop, a bistro and a diner all rolled into one!

this is my coffee spot and more often then i want it's my muffin spot too (get the raspberry!). there's a starbucks 1 block away but if you want to save a lot of money and time come here. i only wish they were open on sundays!

On the "do not fly" list for me after seeing the guy take my cooked chicken off the grill with a spatula he had used to manuever raw chicken with seconds earlier.  That confirmed the sketched out feelings this place had given me for months.  I threw out my sandwich before even leaving the store and have not been back since.   Before that I found the food anywhere from somewhat crappy to quite good, with most of it a solid 3 stars-but ALWAYS overpriced.  Bretts, you are not missed.

This is a common work lunch option for me. They used to have the best ever reuben sandwich. Piled high w/ meat and kraut w/ a little tub of thousand island on the side. Grilled buttery bread. I can almost feel my heart attacking as I sit here thinking about it.  Then I went back a few weeks ago. Their line system changed (understandable..maybe trying to make it more efficient) but it totally threw me off. Then I got my 'wich and it lacked in meat, wasn't grilled the whole way, and they spread a weak and thin layer of thousand on one side of one slice. The price went up a bit. It was even made by the same dude....maybe he was in a hurry. Tear, brett's. Tear. I hope it was just a particularly bad day.

This place is almost always slammed when I go in and for good reason.  Even though this place is just down the road I don't go often for lunch.  The few times I have been there the sandwiches have been good.  I have a feeling if I try a larger variety I would love the place but I just can't get past how slow it is. 3.5 stars for good food (friendly service) just a little slow for me.

I forgot how much I loved this place. I used to work down in the area and can vividly remember my first experience at Brett's.  I walked in at the peak of lunch hour to a frenzy of wire-framed toting skinny architects trying to shout out orders to the overwhelmed cooks.  It was chaos- and I loved every minute of it. This weekend I found myself in the area and had to stop in for some coffee and chaos. Like the rest of the city I was once in love with- Brett's Kitchen has changed!!!!!!  You have to order in a non-chaotic fashion at the register. I was devastated.   I got over this fast as soon as I had my ALT (avocado lettuce and tomato.  See as a vegetarian this place is heaven cause they will deviate from the menu to suite picky eaters).   Brett's Kitchen will always have a warm place in my heart.

Brett's Kitchen has the best egg sandwich in the city.  I haven't visited for a couple of years, but for a few years I used to spend many weekends in that neighborhood, and this was a favorite.   No Sunday hours, which is a major bummer on those mornings when you want an egg sandwich after Saturday night's carousings.

Brett's was okay. I got a grilled cheese sandwich with avocado and a side of cole slaw. Pros? The grilled cheese was amazing. Cheezy (cheddar), the avocado was perfectly ripe and the bread was soft and fresh. Cons? It shouldn't take 25 minutes to make a grilled cheese sandwich when there's only 3 other customers in the shop. Seriously. Oh, and their cole slaw has way too much mayo. It was a giant, gelatinous blob of slaw. I really prefer oil/vinegar slaw to this mess. BLECH.  It's also kinda expensive. $9.00 for a grilled cheese+avocado and a side of slaw? Really?  I liked Brett's, but it's expensive and I'll get my grilled cheeses elsewhere.
There is no Reuben except Reuben, and Bretts is the messenger of Reuben. Reuben sandwich, extra sour + Dr. Bronners Cream Soda = happy me

Brett's has very good food at fairly high prices (hey, it's the neighborhood).    Their sandwich fixins' are always fresh, and their breads taste baked-that-day homemade.  There is plenty to choose from on their menu and they have pretty much anything you could want on a sandwich.    Lots of options for the veggie and the carnivore, some mediterranean selections too!  They also have hot dishes and tons of sides.   Brett's has a very diner-like feel to it, but they manage to keep it clean and welcoming.  The employees are always cheery and efficient. The best part for me is that their roast beef is a perfect medium rare - I don't care for flavorless gray meat so when I want roast beef, Brett's is where I go.

Now that I work in River North again, I can once more enjoy the delights at Brett's during the lunch rush. Their daily specials are interesting and delish, and include such items as salmon/ tabbouleh wraps and tuna tacos with tomatillo sauce.  The staff is very friendly ("your special is EXTRA special today; look how nice I packed it up for you!") and they always pay attention to special requests (i.e. hold the tomato, sauce on the side, etc.).  They have a lot of healthy and/or veggie options, which makes it easier to stay on track with my diet. Oh, and they have a KILLER grilled cheese;) The only down side? They are S-L-O-W and often get orders confused or forget them altogether. Order there, watch them, and make them uncomfortable until you get your meal. I've found it's the best way to avoid serious delays getting back to the office.
Truly a down home gem!  I work in River North and the food is like eating in mama's kitchen!

5 stars alone for the best tuna melt I have ever met and then unapologetically devoured! Get it on the 9-grain bread and you will thank me later. Also, the employees here are cool and funny!  Cute, cafe decor-- love the bowls arranged in rainbow order on the shelves around the perimeter.  Brett's has a grand total of 7 smallish tables, so lunchtime can be a bit snug.  But, the cooks are lightning fast!   I was in and out in 8 minutes. The menu is scrawled out of the chalkboard which creates the perfect antithesis to the typical downtown work mentality, aka "I'm leaving the office to bring lunch back to my desk".  The breakfast items and "healthy/vegetarian" options sounded yummy as well. Thanks Brett's, for making my 8 minutes out of the office that much more enjoyable, and for making the next 15 as I ate my sandwich just heavenly.

I like Brett's, having first discovered them when I worked in the River North area in the late 90s.  They're not the cheapest sandwich shop in town, but the food is consistently good, and the staff is very friendly.  They generally have yummy baked goods. Only problem is that they can get seriously crammed at lunch time, and then it can take a good 15 minutes to get your order.  Not a lot of table space either, so I think it's best for take out.  Still, if you want a good sandwich, Brett's is the right choice.

I need to come back at an earlier time. Actually, I need to come by earlier and just while the crowd dies down. I came here late on a Saturday afternoon and was disappointed at first when they ran out of certain menu items. Boo! The guy preparing the food was really nice though and offered to make me and my guy companion what he could. I ended up with scrambled eggs with cheese and bacon and a side of toast, while my friend got the bacon cheeseburger. As you can tell, we were on the hunt for some bacon. We were both satisfied with our orders and left stuffed.  At the last minute we decided to try some of the bread and ordered to go a slice each of the apple and banana/blueberry breads. Unfortunately, I cannot tell you what the apple bread tasted like because we did got two slices of the banana bread instead, which we did not find out until much later. What I can say though is that banana bread was really sweet and moist.  It went well with the mocha and latte we ordered at the Nordstrom's espresso bar.  PS: I wish they were open on Sundays.

Quick, friendly and a bit pricey. But the food is great. Their portobello mushroom sandwich with provolone is a favorite. They are known for their Mexican chicken sandwich which is flavorful. And you can never go wrong with fries, which I try and steer away from (but continually fail).

Now  that I'm not working in River North anymore, I'm starting to miss Brett. Here's why: two items that made hating my job downright enjoyable: Chorizo & egg sandwich and an almond latte.  It's a little pricey and If you are pressed for time, CALL AHEAD, it gets crazy swamped in there. Tuna Provencal sandwich is great.

Oh yelpers, for the first time, you steered me wrong.  When my trick decided to spend the night, morning breakfast was called for.  The only walk of shame was exiting this place.  I had the omelet, it looked and tasted as if were made in the microwave.  The potatoes were undercooked.  And, paper plates and utensils.  Will never go again.
