Didn't eat there, but got mine delivered, along with my co-worker's meals too.  Fries were decent, but the burgers are, IMNSHO, very close to Culver's, so it was excellent.  Other sandwiches are generally good as well.  Oh yeah, delivery was good, as they took less than an hour.  And other co-workers swear by their food - I would.  Prices are a tag bit expensive, though typical of the River North restaurants and snack bars. Update 1/23/2008 - Cole slaw tasted funny, and in a bad way, but the roast beef sandwich was good, albeit a bit dry (normal with sandwiches like these).  Delivery was top notch, I think it came in 35 minutes after ordering - wow!  Don't mind the nice lady who takes orders over the phone; my co-workers think she's crazy, but she's not! Update 10/8/2009 - Nice walk to this here place...burgers are still excellent, grilled cheese (with bacon) is great, the chili is okay (I like a more balanced chili), rueben is very good, and the baked goods are great.  Still recommend this place, though I am dying to try their breakfast sometime soon - mmm, chorizo & eggs. The prices went up a bit, but not too unreasonable, considering the area its in.  Still worth going for consistently good food! Update 3/1/2010 - Still a nice walk, even in post-winter, burgers are (fine, ok ok!) not like Culver's but still hold their own very very well.  Baked goods are great - cookies are tasty and the blueberry muffin is deee-lish.  Marbled breaded something was good too (forgot the name).  Still the same friendly folks, getting more crowded.  ATM is a bit steep in its fees, but its an off-bank ATM so its to be expected. Still like this place!

Quick and tasty-- that is Brett's kitchen. I grabbed a bite to eat before dress shopping down the street.  Both my best friend and her mom enjoyed their meal as well as her 4 year old's niece.  Coincidence or not, but there were 5 other kids in on that Saturday afternoon. I would never go out of my way to dine at Brett's...but I would stop in if I was in the neighborhood.

I am normally not a sandwich person, but I was coerced to try Brett's for lunch.   What a surprise!  The chicken salad sandwich?  So yummy.  Egg Salad?  The best!   Very fresh, not a gooey mess with unidentifiable chunks.  I hear their grill cheese sandwich is superb, I just was afraid to have it for lunch and had to go back to work.  Next time.   They also have breakfast sandwich, soups, salads and burgers.  If you're in the neighborhood for something quick, check them out!

I love this place.  It is just down the street from where I work and that is both convenient and dangerous - I am tempted to go there every single day.  Their sandwiches are amazing.  The egg salad?  The best I've ever had.  Hands down.  Not too much mayo and tiny pieces of celery.  The veggie sandwich is good too -- veggie's at a lot of places have no flavor...this one is great.  Brett's Kitchen you are a cruel and delicious mistress.  It is crowded but get over it -- it's well worth it.

Based on the accolades of Yelp, I trekked all the way here from my conference one day last week in order to avoid eating at a chain for six meals in a row. The greek chicken sandwich I had was really really good. The chicken was juicy as hell, and the cookie was outa sight. But what really made it worth the hike in a suit in the midday sun was the people. This place has more character than a panera and a potbelly's put together - the woman who rang me up called me doll, sugar AND honey. Now that's sweet.

I work in a food wasteland. Seriously, I really do. That, and I am really lazy, and tend to have the eating habits of a pissed off 6 year old. Brett's has a decent menu, but they totally capitalize on the fact that there is really NOTHING ELSE in the 'hood. I mean come on, 2 bucks for a small container of cottage cheese? 2 bucks for a yogurt? They do have a really great choice of bottled drinks in the back, and Kettle Chips, too. Also, I found somewhere else in the area to get a bagel and cream cheese, where the price is the same as it is here, but you seriously get 3 times the cream cheese (here you get a single little tub, and it's that weird neufchatel stuff). The people who work here are super friendly and HILARIOUS. But Woe betide you if you come in during a lunch rush. It gets more packed than a can of sardines. I'd honestly rather give them my money than Starbucks any day, but to be honest, I like the cookies better at the chain.

I like this place.  For the sandwiches, I recommend the Reuben and egg salad.  They have good burgers and fries too.  And service is fine. Note: If you get a breakfast sandwich, they charge extra for egg whites only, which I don't really understand, since they're cutting out the yolk.

Brett's is great for a cup of coffee or a meal.  Breakfast sandwiches are good, though be sure to be specific and ask for things like cheese.  Sloppy joe/fries combo on thursday is good as is the tuna melt.  Best to eat there as delivery is not the quickest and I like my breakfast hot.  The staff is as friendly and fun as you will find!  The only negatives are that they do close at about 3:30pm and it is relatively expensive.  Stop by anyways...
This is a great lunch spot.  I went there the other day for the first time and had the Mediterranean chicken sandwich, which was excellent.  I also had a slice of pumpkin bread...yum!

I went during the morning rush and it was a little slow (but no slower than a starbucks). I got a caramel iced coffee and a berry muffin and both were delicious. I hope to go back and try the rest of the food soon :-)

I loved this place, when I worked half a block away!! I use to always get their chicken sandwich with fresh avocado and jalapenos. The guys knew me so every time I walked in they greeted me with a huge smile and by my name(that's always a nice perk). It's such good and fresh food and their willing to alter anything on the menu to please their customers.  Great food, cheap prices and awesome customer service!!

Everything is good here...and I really mean everything! Sandwiches, eggs, etc...you can't go wrong no matter what you order! I've ate here about once a week for the past year and have yet to get sick of it.  Don't expect anything fancy, but do expect good food.

Since starting my new job, Brett's has quickly become a favorite spot for lunch.  The staff is definitely fast, but they're also really friendly.  The food is great and decently priced.  I'd recommend grabbing a take out menu and studying up before you step up to the counter.  I keep reminding myself to on a Friday so I can try one of these special brownies people keep talking about.
Good coffee & chocolate chip cookies. It's across the street from where I work. Need I say more?

Fast, affordable, and delicious! Met a few friends here for lunch yesterday and was very impressed with good old Brett's Kitchen.  I had just come from Boot Camp with Jen ( yelp.com/biz/nQVvfE-6VoE… ) and was absolutely starving after Jen kicked my butt on the hills and stairs all morning long! And I came to the right place because my bagel with egg whites & swiss cheese totally hit the spot!   The other girls I was with ate every bite of their meals as well! Fellow yelper, Ali A, said her cheddar cheese & chive omelet was unbelievable, while Dana P went all out with bacon, pancakes and eggs. Dana is one of those annoyingly skinny people who can eat bacon & pancakes & doesn't even do boot camp! Sigh.  Although for those of us who do have to diet it's always fun sneaking bites of Dana's fattening food like the banana bread she also got at Brett's Kitchen yesterday.  I've had a lot of banana bread in my life (it's one of the only things my mom knows how to make) and Brett's banana bread was among the best! Although Brett's  Kitchen was delicious I probably wouldn't go out of my way to come here because there's nothing truly special about it besides  good food, but I"ll definitely be back when in the area.

If you are indecisive DO NOT GO HERE! They have so many delicious choices, from a simple grilled cheese to a crazy sando with all the fixins!  Plus soup or chili if you're into that kind of thing. Their veggie special is so good with the sesame sauce, its so fresh and crisp - just what a veggie special should be. Its difficult navigating your way through, but just when you think that you have had enough the cashier always has a big smile and somethng nice to say. On a side note - their coffee is pretty good too. I have no idea what kind it is, but I like it!

True Hidden Gem.... Its small and cozy, and tough to get a seat during prime hours, but you can get great sandwiches, and unbelievable breakfast food.  Perfect place to hit up on those rough Sunday mornings....

This place is sweet because they serve everything from soup to salad, from lattes to turkey clubs. Their food is top-notch, made with high-quality ingredients and elbow grease. The folks that work here are cool as well, they're always friendly, courteous and silly. I go here sometimes to "grab-a-sammitch" and have yet to be depressed by my purchase. Don't go around noon though, hold out for an off-hour eating time... because it'll be far too packed otherwise. I cannot stand being crowded and confused by the seething masses of sammitch-seekers. Another gripe of mine about Brett's is their traffic flow, which is completely related to my distaste with crowds. The way the line is set up, you order from the beginning of the sammitch counter then proceed backward toward the drinks. The problem with this is that when it is crowded... it gets difficult for the employees to tell who's who and who's been waited on. I often have the problem where someone who came in well after me gets waited on before me because of this traffic flow issue. This is a problem that needs fixing. People should order sammitches at a particular point toward the back of the restaurant. Then they proceed forward and progress toward the cash register, rather than proceeding backward into the restaurant and then having to loop back around to continue onward toward the cash register. One last note. There is no bourbon here, so beware or come prepared! I do like them enough though, to not subtract a star because of it. They should color themselves lucky. Phaw.

i love brett's kitchen.  even though i no longer work in river north [i went at least twice a week when i did] i still go there on occasion and i work in the south loop.  they have the best soups and i have a pavlovian response to mention of their banana bread.

Brett's Kitchen is SUPER!  Super good food (Mexican chicken sandwich-mmmm), super good coffee, super good service, and super good atmosphere for a super good price.  This place blows away any other option in the area for a breakfast or lunch- and on weekends they serve breakfast all day long!

This is my favorite lunch place in river north. They have basic lunch selections at reasonable prices (always cheaper than going to nearby delicious or galleria market) and have a tasty revolving specials - the veggie burrito and veggie burger with mango chutney are my favorites. They also have a pretty extensive hot breakfast selection.

This is a great deli in the River North area.  Perfect for grabbing a cup of coffee or breakfast sandwich in the morning.  AWESOME yogurt  parfaits!!!  It's very convient and gets you in and out right away. i love the help in there.  It is a little over-priced and i guess has gone up over the last year.  This place closes around 3 pm.
